speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: SCENE I. London. A gallery in the palace.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Enter GARDINER, Bishop of Winchester, a Page with a torch before him, met by LOVELL

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: It's one o'clock, boy, is't not?

speaker: Boy
text_entry: It hath struck.

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: These should be hours for necessities,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Not for delights; times to repair our nature

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: With comforting repose, and not for us

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: To waste these times. Good hour of night, Sir Thomas!

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Whither so late?

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Came you from the king, my lord

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: I did, Sir Thomas: and left him at primero

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: With the Duke of Suffolk.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: I must to him too,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Before he go to bed. I'll take my leave.

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Not yet, Sir Thomas Lovell. What's the matter?

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: It seems you are in haste: an if there be

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: No great offence belongs to't, give your friend

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Some touch of your late business: affairs, that walk,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: As they say spirits do, at midnight, have

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: In them a wilder nature than the business

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: That seeks dispatch by day.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: My lord, I love you;

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: And durst commend a secret to your ear

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Much weightier than this work. The queen's in labour,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: They say, in great extremity; and fear'd

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: She'll with the labour end.

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: The fruit she goes with

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: I pray for heartily, that it may find

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Good time, and live: but for the stock, Sir Thomas,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: I wish it grubb'd up now.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Methinks I could

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Cry the amen; and yet my conscience says

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: She's a good creature, and, sweet lady, does

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Deserve our better wishes.

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: But, sir, sir,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Hear me, Sir Thomas: you're a gentleman

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Of mine own way; I know you wise, religious;

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: And, let me tell you, it will ne'er be well,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: 'Twill not, Sir Thomas Lovell, take't of me,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Till Cranmer, Cromwell, her two hands, and she,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Sleep in their graves.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Now, sir, you speak of two

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: The most remark'd i' the kingdom. As for Cromwell,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Beside that of the jewel house, is made master

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: O' the rolls, and the king's secretary; further, sir,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Stands in the gap and trade of moe preferments,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: With which the time will load him. The archbishop

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Is the king's hand and tongue; and who dare speak

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: One syllable against him?

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Yes, yes, Sir Thomas,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: There are that dare; and I myself have ventured

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: To speak my mind of him: and indeed this day,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Sir, I may tell it you, I think I have

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Incensed the lords o' the council, that he is,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: For so I know he is, they know he is,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: A most arch heretic, a pestilence

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: That does infect the land: with which they moved

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Have broken with the king; who hath so far

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Given ear to our complaint, of his great grace

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: And princely care foreseeing those fell mischiefs

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: Our reasons laid before him, hath commanded

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: To-morrow morning to the council-board

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: He be convented. He's a rank weed, Sir Thomas,

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: And we must root him out. From your affairs

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: I hinder you too long: good night, Sir Thomas.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Many good nights, my lord: I rest your servant.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Exeunt GARDINER and Page

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Enter KING HENRY VIII and SUFFOLK

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Charles, I will play no more tonight;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My mind's not on't; you are too hard for me.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sir, I did never win of you before.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: But little, Charles;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Nor shall not, when my fancy's on my play.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Now, Lovell, from the queen what is the news?

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: I could not personally deliver to her

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: What you commanded me, but by her woman

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: I sent your message; who return'd her thanks

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: In the great'st humbleness, and desired your highness

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Most heartily to pray for her.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What say'st thou, ha?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To pray for her? what, is she crying out?

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: So said her woman; and that her sufferance made

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Almost each pang a death.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Alas, good lady!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: God safely quit her of her burthen, and

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: With gentle travail, to the gladding of

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your highness with an heir!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: 'Tis midnight, Charles;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Prithee, to bed; and in thy prayers remember

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The estate of my poor queen. Leave me alone;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: For I must think of that which company

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Would not be friendly to.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I wish your highness

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A quiet night; and my good mistress will

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Remember in my prayers.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Charles, good night.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exit SUFFOLK

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter DENNY

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Well, sir, what follows?

speaker: DENNY
text_entry: Sir, I have brought my lord the archbishop,

speaker: DENNY
text_entry: As you commanded me.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ha! Canterbury?

speaker: DENNY
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: 'Tis true: where is he, Denny?

speaker: DENNY
text_entry: He attends your highness' pleasure.

speaker: DENNY
text_entry: Exit DENNY

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: [Aside]  This is about that which the bishop spake:

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: I am happily come hither.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Re-enter DENNY, with CRANMER

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Avoid the gallery.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: LOVELL seems to stay

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ha! I have said. Be gone. What!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exeunt LOVELL and DENNY

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: [Aside]

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: I am fearful: wherefore frowns he thus?

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: 'Tis his aspect of terror. All's not well.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: How now, my lord! you desire to know

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Wherefore I sent for you.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: [Kneeling]              It is my duty

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: To attend your highness' pleasure.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Pray you, arise,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My good and gracious Lord of Canterbury.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Come, you and I must walk a turn together;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I have news to tell you: come, come, give me your hand.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ah, my good lord, I grieve at what I speak,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And am right sorry to repeat what follows

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I have, and most unwillingly, of late

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Heard many grievous, I do say, my lord,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Grievous complaints of you; which, being consider'd,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Have moved us and our council, that you shall

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This morning come before us; where, I know,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You cannot with such freedom purge yourself,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: But that, till further trial in those charges

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Which will require your answer, you must take

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Your patience to you, and be well contented

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To make your house our Tower: you a brother of us,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: It fits we thus proceed, or else no witness

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Would come against you.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: [Kneeling]

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: I humbly thank your highness;

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And am right glad to catch this good occasion

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Most throughly to be winnow'd, where my chaff

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And corn shall fly asunder: for, I know,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: There's none stands under more calumnious tongues

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Than I myself, poor man.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Stand up, good Canterbury:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Thy truth and thy integrity is rooted

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: In us, thy friend: give me thy hand, stand up:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Prithee, let's walk. Now, by my holidame.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What manner of man are you? My lord, I look'd

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You would have given me your petition, that

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I should have ta'en some pains to bring together

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Yourself and your accusers; and to have heard you,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Without indurance, further.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Most dread liege,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: The good I stand on is my truth and honesty:

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: If they shall fail, I, with mine enemies,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Will triumph o'er my person; which I weigh not,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Being of those virtues vacant. I fear nothing

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: What can be said against me.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Know you not

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: How your state stands i' the world, with the whole world?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Your enemies are many, and not small; their practises

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Must bear the same proportion; and not ever

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The justice and the truth o' the question carries

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The due o' the verdict with it: at what ease

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Might corrupt minds procure knaves as corrupt

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To swear against you? such things have been done.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You are potently opposed; and with a malice

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Of as great size. Ween you of better luck,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I mean, in perjured witness, than your master,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Whose minister you are, whiles here he lived

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Upon this naughty earth? Go to, go to;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You take a precipice for no leap of danger,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And woo your own destruction.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: God and your majesty

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Protect mine innocence, or I fall into

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: The trap is laid for me!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Be of good cheer;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: They shall no more prevail than we give way to.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Keep comfort to you; and this morning see

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You do appear before them: if they shall chance,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: In charging you with matters, to commit you,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The best persuasions to the contrary

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Fail not to use, and with what vehemency

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The occasion shall instruct you: if entreaties

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Will render you no remedy, this ring

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Deliver them, and your appeal to us

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: There make before them. Look, the good man weeps!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: He's honest, on mine honour. God's blest mother!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I swear he is true--hearted; and a soul

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: None better in my kingdom. Get you gone,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And do as I have bid you.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exit CRANMER

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: He has strangled

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: His language in his tears.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter Old Lady, LOVELL following

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: [Within]                 Come back: what mean you?

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: I'll not come back; the tidings that I bring

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Will make my boldness manners. Now, good angels

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Fly o'er thy royal head, and shade thy person

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Under their blessed wings!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Now, by thy looks

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I guess thy message. Is the queen deliver'd?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Say, ay; and of a boy.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Ay, ay, my liege;

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: And of a lovely boy: the God of heaven

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Both now and ever bless her! 'tis a girl,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Promises boys hereafter. Sir, your queen

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Desires your visitation, and to be

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Acquainted with this stranger 'tis as like you

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: As cherry is to cherry.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Lovell!

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Sir?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Give her an hundred marks. I'll to the queen.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: An hundred marks! By this light, I'll ha' more.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: An ordinary groom is for such payment.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: I will have more, or scold it out of him.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Said I for this, the girl was like to him?

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: I will have more, or else unsay't; and now,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: While it is hot, I'll put it to the issue.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Exeunt
